channel.title: 60 years of communism
channel.description:
[QUOTE]China formally kicked off its mass celebrations of 60 years of communist rule with a 60-gun salute that rung out across Beijing's historic Tiananmen Square earlier today. Hundreds of thousands of participants marched past Tiananmen Square in costume or uniform, with floats and dancers mingling with soldiers and military hardware. Collected here are photographs of the once-in-a-decade National Day parade in Beijing, and of others commemorating the anniversary elsewhere. ([url=http://www.boston.com/bigpicture/2009/10/china_celebrates_60_years.html]39 photos total[/url])[/url][url=http://www.boston.com/bigpicture/2009/10/china_celebrates_60_years.html][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c01_20572561.jpg[/img][/url] In this photo released by China's Xinhua News Agency, the phalanx of the national flag receives inspection in a parade in Beijing of the celebrations for the 60th anniversary of the founding of China on Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Xinhua, Huang Jingwen)
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c02_20571437.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo2]2[/iurl]Participants take part during National Day celebrations in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo2]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c03_20573443.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo3]3[/iurl]In this aerial photo released by China's Xinhua News Agency, participants take part in a parade of the celebrations for the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, on Chang'an Street in central Beijing, capital of China, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Xinhua) [iurl=#photo3]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c04_20571383.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo4]4[/iurl]Helicopters from the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) air force fly in formation during a massive parade to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/David Gray) [iurl=#photo4]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c05_20571623.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo5]5[/iurl]Army cadets march in the parade celebrating the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, in central Beijing, on Thursday Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Xinhua, Xie Huanchi) [iurl=#photo5]#[/iurl]
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c06_20573103.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo6]6[/iurl]Chinese military aircraft fly over Tiananmen Square during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (AFP/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo6]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c07_20532969.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo7]7[/iurl]An instructor aligns the formation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) Airborne Corps during a training session at the 60th National Day Parade Village on the outskirts of Beijing, September 15, 2009. (REUTERS/Joe Chan). [iurl=#photo7]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c08_20570691.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo8]8[/iurl]Soldiers from the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) ground force march in formation past Tiananmen Square during a massive parade to mark the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Jason Lee) [iurl=#photo8]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c09_20573825.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo9]9[/iurl]Chinese President Hu Jintao reviews the military personnel during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (AFP/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo9]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c10_20572691.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo10]10[/iurl]Chinese children dressed in costumes wait on Tiananmen Square for the National Day parade to start in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (GOH CHAI HIN/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo10]#[/iurl]
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c11_20572429.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo11]11[/iurl]Chinese President Hu Jintao reviews soldiers before a parade in front of Tiananmen Gate in Beijing to mark the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Joe Chan) [iurl=#photo11]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c12_20572915.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo12]12[/iurl]Dancers take part in a parade to celebrate China's 60th anniversary on October 1, 2009 in Beijing, China. (Feng Li/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo12]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c13_20571931.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo13]13[/iurl]Armored vehicles roll down the street during a parade to mark the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, in central Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Xinhua/Xie Huanchi) [iurl=#photo13]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c14_20573891.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo14]14[/iurl]PLA soldiers stand on military vehicles during a military parade marking China's 60th anniversary near the Tiananmen Square in Beijing, China, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Vincent Thian) [iurl=#photo14]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c15_20573215.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo15]15[/iurl]PLA sailors in white uniforms march past Tiananmen Square during the celebration of China's 60th anniversary on October 1, 2009 in Beijing, China. (Feng Li/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo15]#[/iurl]
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c16_20573251.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo16]16[/iurl]PLA sailors march past Tiananmen Square during the celebration of China's 60th anniversary on October 1, 2009 in Beijing, China. (Feng Li/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo16]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c17_20571941.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo17]17[/iurl]A float with a model of Potala Palace is displayed during a parade to mark the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Nir Elias) [iurl=#photo17]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c18_20573635.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo18]18[/iurl]Women in costume perform in a parade to celebrate China's 60th anniversary on October 1, 2009 in Beijing, China. (Feng Li/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo18]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c19_20573631.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo19]19[/iurl]China's President Hu Jintao (center) and other leaders review a parade to mark China's 60th anniversary on October 1, 2009 in Beijing, China. (Feng Li/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo19]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c20_20571935.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo20]20[/iurl]A migrant worker adjusts the antenna to get a better reception of the live television broadcast of the parade to mark China's 60th anniversary, at their dormitory in Hefei, Anhui province October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Jianan Yu) [iurl=#photo20]#[/iurl]
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c21_20572173.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo21]21[/iurl]A float depicting China's space achievements participates in a parade to mark the 60th China anniversary in Beijing, China, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Ng Han Guan) [iurl=#photo21]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c22_20570501.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo22]22[/iurl]A man takes pictures of PLA aircraft performing a fly-over during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (LIU JIN/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo22]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c23_20532487.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo23]23[/iurl]Dancers from the National Ballet of China performs the "Red Detachment of Women" ballet at the Tanggu Great Theater, part of the celebration of China's 60th anniversary, in Tianjin, September 26, 2009. The "Red Detachment of Women" is a full-length Chinese ballet depicting a peasant woman's journey into the PLA, combining Western dance style with Chinese cultural elements. (REUTERS/Jason Lee) [iurl=#photo23]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c24_20532967.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo24]24[/iurl]Soldiers from the PLA Airborne Corps massage their comrades during a break at a training session at the 60th National Day Parade Village in the outskirts of Beijing, September 15, 2009. (REUTERS/Joe Chan). [iurl=#photo24]#[/iurl] [/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c25_20560621.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo25]25[/iurl]PLA air force pilots salute during a training session for China's 60th anniversary military parade at a military base in Beijing, China. (AP Photo) [iurl=#photo25]#[/iurl]
[/url][img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c26_20574387.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo26]26[/iurl]PLA armored vehicles rumble past Tiananmen Square during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (STR/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo26]#[/iurl] [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c27_20535087.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo27]27Tattoo artist Ren Liang works on a tattoo celebrating China's 60th anniversary on customer Chen Huang's back in his shop in central Beijing September 28, 2009. The small tattoo parlour has had an influx of requests for tattoos which symbolise the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China. (REUTERS/David Gray) [iurl=#photo27]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c28_20574035.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo28]28A float representing modes of transport passes by Tiananmen Square during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (AFP/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo28]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c29_20560383.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo29]29A banquet is held marking China's 60th anniversary on Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2009, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China. (AP Photo/Feng Li, Pool) [iurl=#photo29]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c30_20571593.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo30]30Invited guests watch the parade down Changan Ave. in Beijing, China, on Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (Nelson Ching/Bloomberg) [iurl=#photo30]#
[img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c31_20573299.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo31]31Chinese military personnel march toward Tiananmen Square during the National Day parade in Beijing on October 1, 2009. (STR/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo31]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c32_20570685.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo32]32PLA tanks roll past Tiananmen Square in a massive parade to mark the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Nir Elias) [iurl=#photo32]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c33_20573975.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo33]33Local residents watch the military parade on TV in a shopping mall in Chengdu in southwest China's Sichuan province, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo) [iurl=#photo33]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c34_20573551.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo34]34Participants prepare for an evening performance to mark China's 60th anniversary in Tiananmen Square in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Jason Lee) [iurl=#photo34]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c35_20575031.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo35]35A man watches a huge overhead screen showing soldiers of the People's Liberation Army marching, at a shopping mall in Beijing, China, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2009. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) [iurl=#photo35]#
[img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c36_20574569.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo36]36Fireworks explode over Tiananmen Square during an evening performance to mark China's 60th anniversary, in Beijing October 1, 2009. (REUTERS/Xinhua/Huang Jingwen) [iurl=#photo36]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c37_20574695.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo37]37Fireworks light up Victoria Harbour to celebrate Chinese National Day in Hong kong on October 1, 2009. Large crowds gathered on the waterfront in Hong Kong to celebrate the 60th Anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China. (ED Jones/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo37]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c38_20568879.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo38]38The Empire State Building is lit with red and yellow lights to mark China's 60th anniversary on September 30, 2009 in New York. (STAN HONDA/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo38]# [img]http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c39_20574857.jpg[/img] [iurl=#photo39]39A child watches as fireworks light up Victoria Harbour to celebrate Chinese National Day in Hong kong on October 1, 2009. (ED Jones/AFP/Getty Images) [iurl=#photo39]#
source: http://www.boston.com/bigpicture/2009/10/china_celebrates_60_years.html[/QUOTE] found this on another forum, thought it would make discussion for you

item.title: 60 years of communism

item.description:

Ching Chang Chinaman! So disciplined… Im surprised no one attempted to assassinate him. lol

item.title: 60 years of communism
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“SonGoku, post:37, topic:305589”]To the people shouting ‘propaganda!!!’ - How come it’s only propaganda when your country isn’t doing it? When your country does it, however, it’s not propaganda, but having a good time (I’m mostly talking to Americans).

And I agree with a few peoples posts, China isn’t really communist. In fact, most countries that claim they are are not, as they have a dictatorship set up. (North Korea is a good example here).[/quote]
Please Read “How to be a good communist” by Liu Shaoqi…

Read full topic

item.title: 60 years of communism
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

To the people shouting ‘propaganda!!!’ - How come it’s only propaganda when your country isn’t doing it? When your country does it, however, it’s not propaganda, but having a good time (I’m mostly talking to Americans).

And I agree with a few peoples posts, China isn’t really communist. In fact, most countries that claim they are are not, as they have a dictatorship set up. (North Korea is a good example here).

item.title: 60 years of communism
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:20, topic:305589”]Haha. Some of the night shots at the very bottom looked really nice.

What I don’t understand though is how anyone can like being part of a communist nation when they get so little a say in their life.[/quote]

It’s a way of life, they grow up with it and with the notion that everyone is part of the “People” and everyone has a part to play. National pride is very strong in China and I think they just feel like a massive epic team. And there are some people who rebel, but they just leave the country (or get pwned).

Read full topic

item.title: 60 years of communism
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:20, topic:305589”]Haha. Some of the night shots at the very bottom looked really nice.

What I don’t understand though is how anyone can like being part of a communist nation when they get so little a say in their life.[/quote]

For starters, China isn’t a real Communist nation. Not even in the time of Zedong, at least not the Marx/Engels version of Communism. Real Communism means that everyone rules the nation.

I really like military parades. Especially when they contain this: http://inapcache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/china60_10_01/c16_20573251.jpg

Read full topic
